about  people gathered Friday to remember University of Minnesota medical student Ashley Hasti PERIOD

by  Aaron JobPublished  June  

A memorial was held in the University of Minnesotas Mayo Auditorium on Friday for the friends and family of medical student Ashley Hasti a victim of alleged UCLA shooter Mainak Sarkar PERIOD

Hasti was found dead in a Brooklyn Park home on June  after her name appeared on the shooters kill list left in his St PERIOD Paul apartment PERIOD

About  subdued onlookers listened to colleagues faculty members and relatives speak in remembrance of the 31yearold PERIOD

She had a strong sense of what was right and wrong PERIOD She was like a comic book hero said one friend adding that Hasti often wore a blanket over her shoulders resembling a cape PERIOD

Another speaker read a letter to Hastis family from Dr PERIOD Jane Lewis assistant professor in the Universitys Department of Urology who wrote that she was not emotionally ready to speak to them PERIOD

Hasti was a complex person PERIOD Intelligent and had personal problems getting through medical school Lewis wrote PERIOD Her life mattered and she will be remembered. a white blanket marked with colorful tracings of hands  a gift from a UCLA student  was displayed outside the auditorium with a photo collage of Hasti laid out around it PERIOD

She was one of the smartest coolest and funniest people I knew said her sister Alex Hasti PERIOD

Hastis classmates spoke about how she always had fun but was dedicated to her studies and work PERIOD

A member of Hastis comedy club and classmate said it seemed to me she had a knack for everything PERIOD I wanted to see everything she would go on to do  Other comedy writers are too afraid to share their ideas she was always willing and always coming up with new ones. another family member closed her speech with what she said was Hastis favorite quote from her favorite movie the Princess Bride As you wish Ashley. get MN Daily NEWS delivered to your inbox Monday through Friday
